dlgLine.text: I called this meeting to discuss a potential health threat to the shelter.
As of the last day or so, several people have come down with a nasty case of pneumonia. From all appearances, it seems to be a bad strain of strep causing this flu.
Anyone who has caught it is experiencing high fever, chills, coughing, and lethargy. They're unable to stand, much less carry out their duties.
If this starts spreading to anyone else, we're going to have a hard time running this place. So... how do we deal with this?
From what I've read, quarantine's the only way to do it - we might not be here if someone had done that to the first people to come back from the dead.
<To you> If you think we should do this another way, I'm willing to consider it.
Keep everyone else away from them - we can't risk anyone else getting sick.
Strep is a bacteria. If we really want to knock this out, we need to kill it before it spreads. Let's use some of our antibiotic supply to kill it in anyone with flu symptoms.
<To you> Unless you have a better idea.
I know antibiotics are important, but we need to nuke this flu before it kills our ability to remain operational.
I think this is a waste of time - are we seriously making a judgment call because a few people came down with the sniffles? We shouldn't be spending any resources on the sick.
<To you> I can pretend to care, if that's what you want.
People are sick. It happens. We have bigger problems to worry about.
Keep them the hell away from me. I don't want those sick fuckers anywhere near me.
<To you> You got a better idea? Well, maybe I can get on board. Maybe.
I hate being sick - seal them in a room until there's no chance I'm going to get it.
I'd prefer we used antibiotics to help people as soon as possible.
<To you> Unless you think there's a better way.
We can find or make other antibiotics - we don't want to risk anyone's health over this.
I think we need to use our antibiotics to treat the healthy - why are we saving them just for infected people?
<To you> Unless you've got a good reason otherwise, you know where I stand on the issue.
Start treating this flu with antibiotics immediately - let's nip this in the bud before it gets worse.
<To you> How do you think we should resolve this?

dlgAnsw.text: It's just the flu - we can't spend any time or resources on it.
We're going to prescribe antibiotics to anyone who has it. <-30 antibiotics>
We're going to quarantine the ill for five days. <-5 days for ill allies>
As leaders, we should all ration our food for a week as a display of our commitment to the people here to solve this.
We ate yesterday, so today we go without. We will resume normal rations tomorrow.
We have too many mouths to feed. Leave it to me... I'll take care of our problem the more direct way.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to ignore the illness and continue as usual. Is that your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to free up antibiotics for use in controlling the flu. Is that your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to quarantine the infected for five days. Is that your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to immediately serve items that many here wouldn't normally eat to boost the immediate supply of food in the shelter. Is this your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to cut food to the whole shelter for today in order to preserve more food for the future. It will be crucial that we find more food today. Is this your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: ...I'm not sure I agree with the implication of that decision. Are you sure that's how you want to proceed?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The final decision is to ignore the strep infection and hope it does not infect anyone else.
Well, if you think there's nothing to worry about, I guess we shouldn't panic everyone...
And if you or I or the rest of us get sick, who's going to protect this place? Who's going to go out and get food? Or fix the fence? It's goddamn irresponsible.
If that's how you want to do it, well, we'll just have to encourage people to try to avoid too much interaction with the sick.
So, the sick will just get worse and stay infectious even longer. Oh yeah, that won't backfire at all.
Good. Looks like you and I are the only ones with the good sense to not panic about this.
Good. Looks like you and I are the only ones with the good sense to not panic about this.
...Okay. But you better hope no one else gets this shit. Especially me.
If I get sick, I'm going to hock a loogie in your mouth... Asshole.
It seems like we could do more, but I suppose we can always pray for a speedy recovery.
My feeling is that most people will take this to mean you're abandoning them to their fate. I'm afraid they've already felt abandoned by authority enough at this point.
I can understand the strain on our resources otherwise, so I suppose we need to make people aware of how that affected your decision.
Doing nothing - that's your solution? If this plague of death has taught us anything, it's that you do everything you can to protect the welfare of your people!
VOID.
I don't know if I would have thought of it, but it sets a good example and it should put a lot of people at ease about our intentions. I can get behind this.
I don't know if I would have thought of it, but it sets a good example and it should put a lot of people at ease about our intentions. I can get behind this.
I think it's a difficult sacrifice that we can all make. Overall, it's a pretty shrewd move that should boost everyone's faith in our ability to get them through this.
I think it's a difficult sacrifice that we can all make. Overall, it's a pretty shrewd move that should boost everyone's faith in our ability to get them through this.
I'm not really on board with this... but I'll cash in one of my favors to you and go along with it.
That couldn't be farther from what I want. You want me to give up food for these people? I don't even know half their names.
Eat less? You know, I'll do it because I guess sometimes you don't make me regret coming here, but don't make this a regular thing.
You want ME to eat less?! What the hell kind of logic is that? We're in charge - if anything, it should be the other way around.
...I like it. I think it says a lot about all our character and I'm sure that the people here will appreciate it, and maybe even willingly cooperate with us through any further hardships.
...I like it. I think it says a lot about all our character and I'm sure that the people here will appreciate it, and maybe even willingly cooperate with us through any further hardships.
I disagree, but... maybe you'll prove me wrong, I don't know.
It's a strong move... I like it. It sends the right message and buys good will in a way that nothing else will. Sure, we'll have to tighten our belts, but everyone will see us do it.
The decision is to dedicate antibiotics to the sick to promote a speedier recovery and less of a chance of spreading the flu.
I'm worried about our antibiotic supply, but at least you're doing something.
I understand you're reasoning, but dammit, if we run out of antibiotics, people aren't just going to get sick - they're going to die. That's a helluva lot worse.
Good call. We need to treat this as soon as possible.
Good call. We need to treat this as soon as possible.
I can see where this might go over well around here... but I'm only backing it because I might need a favor in the future.
You're blowing one of our most precious resources on a cough? This should end well...
Yeah... Okay. As long as I don't get sick.
Not only do we blow our pills on this, but they're still going to be walking around touching doorknobs and coughing and shit. Can't stand being around sick people...
I'm glad that you're worried enough to give these people access to antibiotics. It really shows you value their well-being.
I'm glad that you're worried enough to give these people access to antibiotics. It really shows you value their well-being.
Great - a proactive decision is just what we need right now. It shows strong commitment by the leadership here.
Great - a proactive decision is just what we need right now. It shows strong commitment by the leadership here.
The decision is to quarantine the sick for five days.
Good. If there's anything we've learned from this whole mess, it's that you don't take any chances when it comes to disease.
Good. If there's anything we've learned from this whole mess, it's that you don't take any chances when it comes to disease.
If you really feel good about this, I'll support your decision.
It's not going to be great for morale - nobody likes being detained and it makes it seem like we're hiding something worse from our people.
If that's how you're going to do things, then I suppose I'll just have to roll with it.
So, we lose even more work from those people, and meanwhile, the whole place is abuzz about a 'flu' lockdown - sound familiar to anyone?
Good. Keep 'em the hell away from me until a doc gives them a clean bill of health and a lollipop.
Good. Keep 'em the hell away from me until a doc gives them a clean bill of health and a lollipop.
It should stop the threat of the flu, so at least there's that.
I don't think people are going to appreciate a quarantine, even if they know why. There are more direct ways of fighting this flu.
Well, we're still helping contain the spread, I guess.
This is going to leave an awful lot of work to be done by the rest of us. And if this quarantine doesn't work, what then?
The decision is to cut all food today, conserve resources for the future, and hopefully secure more food immediately.
I can handle a lean day, sure, but we're really going to have to bust our asses and bring home full packs today.
I can handle a lean day, sure, but we're really going to have to bust our asses and bring home full packs today.
It's a compromise I'm willing to support.
It's a compromise I'm willing to support.
I'm really not happy about this, but I'll back you up because I have confidence you won't make this a weekly event.
No food today? And what happens if we're attacked or driven out of here? We'll be dead on our feet. <Shakes his head> You people...
Do I look like I diet? Still, I guess you've stuck your neck out for me before, so I can deal with it.
So let me get this straight - I don't eat and you'll probably make me do the heavy lifting out there? Well, why didn't you say we were having shit sandwiches for dinner?
I don't think it's too much to ask. As long as we make progress on our food situation today.
I don't think it's too much to ask. As long as we make progress on our food situation today.
It makes sense, I suppose. As long as we come back with some food today, we shouldn't have to worry about any backlash.
It makes sense, I suppose. As long as we come back with some food today, we shouldn't have to worry about any backlash.
The decision is to... find a way to reduce the population here at the shelter through whatever means necessary.
I... I really hope that you mean you're going to find a volunteer.
What the hell is this - the damn mafia? I swear on my goddamn life that if I hear you took someone behind a shed and put a bullet in them about this, I'm taking you down!
I have to believe you've got a better plan than just fragging the last person to piss you off. Right?
If you're going to turn this into a dictatorship, you better believe I will work with everyone else to depose you.
Well, does anyone want to pick the last guy left for the dodgeball team, really? It's harsh but they're probably not going to last long anyhow.
Well, does anyone want to pick the last guy left for the dodgeball team, really? It's harsh but they're probably not going to last long anyhow.
If you're going to rule by fear, I say you have to draw a line somewhere, but on the other hand I'm fairly sure you won't pick me, so I'm willing to let it slide.
That sounds like something Marshall would do... And I'm sure as hell not going to stay if I have to live in fear of being on your shit list.
I hope this is just a misunderstanding... Based on our previous actions, I have to believe you're going to do the right thing.
I know that sometimes you have to kill because otherwise we all would be killed. But murder is a sin...
Well... I suppose you could always find someone who's unhappy and give them the option to leave...
No one is judge, jury, and executioner - this is madness! If this is how you intend to run the place, maybe it's time to elect a new leader!
That concludes our meeting... Let's hope no one else gets sick.
